content: In what country was the board game "Risk" invented, originally called "La Conquête du Monde" (The Conquest of the World)?

"Risk," originally known as "La Conquête du Monde" (The Conquest of the World), was invented in France. The game was created by French film director Albert Lamorisse and was first published in 1957 by Editions Jacques Gérin in France. It later gained international popularity after being licensed to other companies, including Parker Brothers in the United States, who released it under the name "Risk" in 1959.

So, to answer your question directly, the board game "Risk" was invented in France.
